Founders / Founding Members: Sunderland Association Football Club was founded in 1879 in Sunderland, Tyne and Wear, England. Originally established to represent the town in organised football, the club quickly became a significant force in early English football.
About the Club: Sunderland AFC is a professional football club based in Sunderland, England. The Black Cats compete in the Premier League for the 2025–26 season after earning promotion via the Championship play-offs in 2025. Founded in 1879, Sunderland have a rich history in English football, with periods of top-flight success and memorable cup runs. The club’s iconic Stadium of Light, opened in 1997, is known for its passionate atmosphere. Under head coach Régis Le Bris, appointed in June 2024, Sunderland achieved promotion from the Championship at the end of the 2024–25 season and are now competing in the Premier League. Granit Xhaka serves as club captain for the 2025–26 campaign as Sunderland aim to establish themselves and achieve sustained top-flight status.
